intro: Calandrinia cymosa, commonly known as the "pink sand verbena," is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces vibrant pink to magenta flowers that bloom in dense clusters, typically from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its succulent leaves and showy flowers make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens.
